thread.title: Perils of Patrons Progressing to the Perpetration of Art

author: wsjcom
title: Perils of Patrons Progressing to the Perpetration of Art
text: Regarding Eric Gibson’s “An Art Patron’s Forgotten Creativity” (Life & Arts, Feb. 5): Perhaps it wasn’t the 1913 Armory Show that buried the artistic success of sculptor Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney, nor her being a woman “in those days.” Ever since then our society has tacitly assumed and accepted that a rich person doing art is just a dilettante. A wealthy artist often has two choices to make: either use money to buy artistic recognition, or to remain passive contemplating one’s artistic efforts being ignored by the hypocritical art world of the time. There may be some exceptions, but as a rule all other explanations...
